intro: Cissampelos hypoglauca, commonly known as the white milk vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by bright orange or red berries. Its latex is milky and contains compounds that have been used traditionally in some cultures for medicinal purposes. The species is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks.
